seo.title: How coaching works | SustainSage
seo.description: Understand how SustainSage coaching aligns with ICF standards, what happens in a session, and how it differs from mentoring or therapy.

hero.title: What coaching with us actually looks like
hero.subtitle: We follow International Coaching Federation (ICF) ethics: you stay in authorship; we provide structure, reflection and consent-based experiments.

definition.title: Coaching, defined
paragraphs: ICF describes coaching as a partnership that sparks clients’ thinking and creativity. In practice, it is a series of confidential conversations where you lead the agenda and we hold structure, questions and accountability.
We do not advise, diagnose or sell quick fixes. We co-design experiments so you can make informed choices that respect your context.

session.title: Inside a typical session
session.intro: Sessions last 55–60 minutes (longer for Deepening). We work online unless otherwise agreed.
items: We begin by naming what feels most alive or urgent today.
Together we map systems, emotions, assumptions and options.
We reflect themes back, celebrate wins and pause when discomfort needs tending.
You end with choices or experiments you consent to.

comparison.title: Coaching vs mentoring vs therapy
comparison.caption: This overview helps you choose the right support. They can complement each other, and we will signpost alternatives when needed.

rows.mentoring: Passing on experience, advice and networks.
rows.therapy: Healing past or present mental health concerns.

rows.coaching: You set the agenda; coach reflects and questions.
rows.mentoring: Mentor often suggests topics and solutions.
rows.therapy: Collaborative; therapist assesses and guides clinical care.

rows.coaching: Non-directive, non-clinical. Stops when trauma or safety concerns surface.
rows.therapy: Clinical diagnosis and treatment delivered by licensed professionals.

ethics.title: Boundaries and confidentiality
ethics.intro: We honour ICF ethics and UK safeguarding law. It means:
items: We keep conversations confidential unless there is risk of harm or legal obligation to disclose.
We obtain consent before sharing stories externally or inviting collaborators into a session.
We pause and signpost when issues require therapy, legal, medical or financial expertise.

expectations.title: What we ask of clients
bullets: Arrive with something real to explore, even if it feels messy or incomplete.
Tell us when pace, language or cultural framing needs adjusting.
Protect time after sessions to integrate insights, celebrate wins or rest.
Let us know early if circumstances change so we can re-contract.

cta.body: If this way of working resonates, browse the packages or book the 20-minute chat so we can confirm fit together.
